column4: why would ssh pubkey authentication not work from a 8.04.4 client to a 10.04 server?
the key is silently ignored by the server
tried reimporting the key?
import where? Both are servers, there are no agents running
try:  dpkg -S sources.list
There are sample files online, or you can boot the liveCD/USB and copy the default one from there  to your internal partition
no, I don't want to edit that file. I want to know against which package to report a bug.
edit what file?
Suppose there is a bug in sources.list. Where do I report the bug?
oic, then report it against the apt package
sources.list won't have bugs, its a config file
what issues are you seeing?
then thats an issue witht that server, not the sources.list file
i'd still use apt as the thing to report against
is there a change you need to make to make it use ipv6?
IPv6-only network
is there no change you can make to use ipv6, to the sources.list file?
sure I can. That's what I did. But IMO I shouldn't have to edit that file, the default installation should just work.
there is no reason us.archive.ubuntu.com (or the default servers that are in sources.list) shouldn't be reachable through IPv6
I guess, depends on DNS
dig AAAA us.archive.ubuntu.com. Try it for yourself.
